title: Hereditary C*-subalgebra
summary: In mathematics, a hereditary C*-subalgebra of a C*-algebra is a particular type of C*-subalgebra whose structure is closely related to that of the larger C*-algebra. A C*-subalgebra  B of A is a hereditary C*-subalgebra if for all a ∈ A and b ∈ B such that 0 ≤ a ≤ b, we have a ∈ B.[1]
